definition[0]: a trust whose managers are allowed to decide the best way of managing the trust and the best way of sharing its income and capital
example[0]: A discretionary trust fund was set up to help disabled people living at home.
definition[1]: an arrangement for leaving money to someone in a TRUST after you die, where the person managing the trust decides when to make payments, how much to pay etc
example[1]: If you are worried about your relative not being able to manage money, you could leave a sum of money on discretionary trust.
